required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transcutaneous Auricular Vagus Nerve Stimulation Treatment on Meniere Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Transcutaneous Auricular Vagus Nerve Stimulation for the Treatment of Meniere Disease: a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Objective: To evaluate the effect of Transcutaneous auricular vagus nerve stimulation for the patients Meniere disease.
Methods: We accrued 25 patients at Beijing TongRen Hospital. All treatments were self-administered by the patients at home after training at the hospital. Patients completed questionnaires at baseline and after 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks.
Tinnitus Handicap Inventory (THI), Dizziness Handicap Inventory (DHI), Pure Tone Audiometry, visual scale of ear stuffiness and SF-36 were performed to evaluate the therapeutic effects.
A difference of P < 0.05 was considered statistically significant.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change from Baseline in the Tinnitus Handicap Inventory (THI) rating scale at 12 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Tinnitus Handicap Inventory (THI) to measure the subjective tinnitus symptoms. Tinnitus Handicap Inventory (THI) to measure the subjective tinnitus symptoms

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change from Baseline in the Dizziness Handicap Inventory (DHI) at 12 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: DHI to measure the subjective dizziness symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change from Baseline in the Pure Tone Audiometry at 12 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Pure Tone Audiometry to measure the audition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from Baseline in the 36-items Short Form(SF-36) at 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: SF-36 to measure quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from Baseline in the visual scale of ear stuffiness at 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Visual scale to measure the subjective ear stuffiness symptoms

intervention.description: taVNS was applied using a Huatuo stimulator (SDZ-IIB) developed by Suzhou manufacture of Medical Device and Material. Stimulation parameters was 1 mA of electrical current at a frequency of 20 Hz with pulse duration â‰¤ 1 ms, for 30min,administered twice daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age >=18 and Age <=70.
2. Clinical diagnosis of meniere disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of depression, tumors, thyroid disease, diabetes, cardiac diseases.
2. History of Otorhinolaryngology surgery.
3. Pregnant or lactating women.
